slides.label: Pueblo Bonito
slides.caption: Photograph of the ruins at Pueblo Bonito, part of the ancient construction efforts of the Ancestral Puebloan people at Chaco Canyon. Courtesy of Scott Haefner.

slides.label: The Kivas
slides.caption: In Chaco Canyon, a kiva, or ceremonial structure, was constructed for every twenty-nine rooms. Additionally, nine complexes in the canyon housed oversized kivas which measured up to sixty-three feet in diameter. Courtesy of National Park Service, U.S. Department of the Interior.

slides.label: Stones Left Standing
slides.caption: Photo of the rear, north wall of Pueblo Bonito. Recent findings suggest that Pueblo Bonito may have been a ceremonial site, rather than a habitation. The debate continues among scholars of archaeology and history. 	Courtesy of National Park Service, U.S. Department of the Interior.

slides.label: Pathways
slides.caption: As seen from above, archaeologists believe that the pathways served both ritual and functional purposes due to their unusually straight construction, as well as the fact that some lead away from the settlement while others do not. Courtesy of NASA.
